00003 #include <iostream>
00004 #include <fstream>

00007 #define IMG_OK              0x1
00008 #define IMG_ERR_NO_FILE     0x2
00009 #define IMG_ERR_MEM_FAIL    0x4
00010 #define IMG_ERR_BAD_FORMAT  0x8
00011 #define IMG_ERR_UNSUPPORTED 0x40
00012  
00013 class TGAImg
00014  {
00015   public:
00016    TGAImg();
00017    ~TGAImg();
00018    int Load(char* szFilename);
00019    int GetBPP();
00020    int GetWidth();
00021    int GetHeight();
00022    unsigned char* GetImg();       // Return a pointer to image data
00023    unsigned char* GetPalette();   // Return a pointer to VGA palette
00024  
00025   private:
00026    short int iWidth,iHeight,iBPP;

00029    unsigned char *pImage, *pPalette, *pData;

00033    int LoadRawData();
00034    int LoadTgaRLEData();

00070  
00071 int TGAImg::Load(char* szFilename)
00072  {
00073   using namespace std;
00074   ifstream fIn;
00075   unsigned long ulSize;
00076   int iRet;
00077  
00078   // Clear out any existing image and palette
00079    if(pImage)
00080     {
00081      delete [] pImage;
00082      pImage=NULL;
00083     }
00084  
00085    if(pPalette)
00086     {
00087      delete [] pPalette;
00088      pPalette=NULL;
00089     }
00090  
00091   // Open the specified file
00092   fIn.open(szFilename,ios::binary);
00093     
00094    if(fIn==NULL)
00095     return IMG_ERR_NO_FILE;
00096  
00097   // Get file size
00098   fIn.seekg(0,ios_base::end);
00099   ulSize=fIn.tellg();
00100   fIn.seekg(0,ios_base::beg);
00101  
00102   // Allocate some space
00103   // Check and clear pDat, just in case
00104    if(pData)
00105     delete [] pData; 
00106  
00107   pData=new unsigned char[ulSize];
00108  
00109    if(pData==NULL)
00110     {
00111      fIn.close();
00112      return IMG_ERR_MEM_FAIL;
00113     }
00114  
00115   // Read the file into memory
00116   fIn.read((char*)pData,ulSize);
00117  
00118   fIn.close();
00119  
00120   // Process the header
00121   iRet=ReadHeader();
00122  
00123    if(iRet!=IMG_OK)
00124     return iRet;
00125  
00126    switch(bEnc)
00127     {
00128      case 1: // Raw Indexed
00129       {
00130        // Check filesize against header values
00131         if((lImageSize+18+pData[0]+768)>ulSize)
00132          return IMG_ERR_BAD_FORMAT;
00133  
00134        // Double check image type field
00135         if(pData[1]!=1)
00136          return IMG_ERR_BAD_FORMAT;
00137  
00138        // Load image data
00139        iRet=LoadRawData();
00140         if(iRet!=IMG_OK)
00141          return iRet;
00142  
00143        // Load palette
00144        iRet=LoadTgaPalette();
00145         if(iRet!=IMG_OK)
00146          return iRet;
00147  
00148        break;
00149       }
00150  
00151      case 2: // Raw RGB
00152       {
00153        // Check filesize against header values
00154         if((lImageSize+18+pData[0])>ulSize)
00155          return IMG_ERR_BAD_FORMAT;
00156  
00157        // Double check image type field
00158         if(pData[1]!=0)
00159          return IMG_ERR_BAD_FORMAT;
00160  
00161        // Load image data
00162        iRet=LoadRawData();
00163         if(iRet!=IMG_OK)
00164          return iRet;
00165  
00166        BGRtoRGB(); // Convert to RGB
00167        break;
00168       }
00169  
00170      case 9: // RLE Indexed
00171       {
00172        // Double check image type field
00173         if(pData[1]!=1)
00174          return IMG_ERR_BAD_FORMAT;
00175  
00176        // Load image data
00177        iRet=LoadTgaRLEData();
00178         if(iRet!=IMG_OK)
00179          return iRet;
00180  
00181        // Load palette
00182        iRet=LoadTgaPalette();
00183         if(iRet!=IMG_OK)
00184          return iRet;
00185  
00186        break;
00187       }
00188  
00189      case 10: // RLE RGB
00190       {
00191        // Double check image type field
00192         if(pData[1]!=0)
00193          return IMG_ERR_BAD_FORMAT;
00194  
00195        // Load image data
00196        iRet=LoadTgaRLEData();
00197         if(iRet!=IMG_OK)
00198          return iRet;
00199  
00200        BGRtoRGB(); // Convert to RGB
00201        break;
00202       }
00203  
00204      default:
00205       return IMG_ERR_UNSUPPORTED;
00206     }
00207  
00208   // Check flip bit
00209    if((pData[17] & 0x20)==0) 
00210      FlipImg();
00211  
00212   // Release file memory
00213   delete [] pData;
00214   pData=NULL;
00215  
00216   return IMG_OK;
00217  }
00218  
00219  
00220 int TGAImg::ReadHeader() // Examine the header and populate our class attributes
00221  {
00222   short ColMapStart,ColMapLen;
00223   short x1,y1,x2,y2;
00224  
00225    if(pData==NULL)
00226     return IMG_ERR_NO_FILE;
00227  
00228    if(pData[1]>1)    // 0 (RGB) and 1 (Indexed) are the only types we know about
00229     return IMG_ERR_UNSUPPORTED;
00230  
00231    bEnc=pData[2];     // Encoding flag  1 = Raw indexed image
00232                       //                2 = Raw RGB
00233                       //                3 = Raw greyscale
00234                       //                9 = RLE indexed
00235                       //               10 = RLE RGB
00236                       //               11 = RLE greyscale
00237                       //               32 & 33 Other compression, indexed
00238  
00239     if(bEnc>11)       // We don't want 32 or 33
00240      return IMG_ERR_UNSUPPORTED;
00241  
00242  
00243   // Get palette info
00244   memcpy(&ColMapStart,&pData[3],2);
00245   memcpy(&ColMapLen,&pData[5],2);
00246  
00247   // Reject indexed images if not a VGA palette (256 entries with 24 bits per entry)
00248    if(pData[1]==1) // Indexed
00249     {
00250      if(ColMapStart!=0 || ColMapLen!=256 || pData[7]!=24)
00251       return IMG_ERR_UNSUPPORTED;
00252     }
00253  
00254   // Get image window and produce width & height values
00255   memcpy(&x1,&pData[8],2);
00256   memcpy(&y1,&pData[10],2);
00257   memcpy(&x2,&pData[12],2);
00258   memcpy(&y2,&pData[14],2);
00259  
00260   iWidth=(x2-x1);
00261   iHeight=(y2-y1);
00262  
00263    if(iWidth<1 || iHeight<1)
00264     return IMG_ERR_BAD_FORMAT;
00265  
00266   // Bits per Pixel
00267   iBPP=pData[16];
00268  
00269   // Check flip / interleave byte
00270    if(pData[17]>32) // Interleaved data
00271     return IMG_ERR_UNSUPPORTED;
00272  
00273   // Calculate image size
00274   lImageSize=(iWidth * iHeight * (iBPP/8));
00275  
00276   return IMG_OK;
00277  }
00278  
00279  
00280 int TGAImg::LoadRawData() // Load uncompressed image data
00281  {
00282   short iOffset;
00283  
00284    if(pImage) // Clear old data if present
00285     delete [] pImage;
00286  
00287   pImage=new unsigned char[lImageSize];
00288  
00289    if(pImage==NULL)
00290     return IMG_ERR_MEM_FAIL;
00291  
00292   iOffset=pData[0]+18; // Add header to ident field size
00293  
00294    if(pData[1]==1) // Indexed images
00295     iOffset+=768;  // Add palette offset
00296  
00297    memcpy(pImage,&pData[iOffset],lImageSize);
00298  
00299   return IMG_OK;
00300  }
00301  
00302  
00303 int TGAImg::LoadTgaRLEData() // Load RLE compressed image data
00304  {
00305   short iOffset,iPixelSize;
00306   unsigned char *pCur;
00307   unsigned long Index=0;
00308   unsigned char bLength,bLoop;
00309  
00310   // Calculate offset to image data
00311   iOffset=pData[0]+18;
00312  
00313   // Add palette offset for indexed images
00314    if(pData[1]==1)
00315     iOffset+=768; 
00316  
00317   // Get pixel size in bytes
00318   iPixelSize=iBPP/8;
00319  
00320   // Set our pointer to the beginning of the image data
00321   pCur=&pData[iOffset];
00322  
00323   // Allocate space for the image data
00324    if(pImage!=NULL)
00325     delete [] pImage;
00326  
00327   pImage=new unsigned char[lImageSize];
00328  
00329    if(pImage==NULL)
00330     return IMG_ERR_MEM_FAIL;
00331  
00332   // Decode
00333    while(Index<lImageSize) 
00334     {
00335       if(*pCur & 0x80) // Run length chunk (High bit = 1)
00336        {
00337         bLength=*pCur-127; // Get run length
00338         pCur++;            // Move to pixel data  
00339  
00340         // Repeat the next pixel bLength times
00341          for(bLoop=0;bLoop!=bLength;++bLoop,Index+=iPixelSize)
00342           memcpy(&pImage[Index],pCur,iPixelSize);
00343   
00344         pCur+=iPixelSize; // Move to the next descriptor chunk
00345        }
00346       else // Raw chunk
00347        {
00348         bLength=*pCur+1; // Get run length
00349         pCur++;          // Move to pixel data
00350  
00351         // Write the next bLength pixels directly
00352          for(bLoop=0;bLoop!=bLength;++bLoop,Index+=iPixelSize,pCur+=iPixelSize)
00353           memcpy(&pImage[Index],pCur,iPixelSize);
00354        }
00355     }
00356  
00357   return IMG_OK;
00358  }
00359  
00360  
00361 int TGAImg::LoadTgaPalette() // Load a 256 color palette
00362  {
00363   unsigned char bTemp;
00364   short iIndex,iPalPtr;
00365   
00366    // Delete old palette if present
00367    if(pPalette)
00368     {
00369      delete [] pPalette;
00370      pPalette=NULL;
00371     }
00372  
00373   // Create space for new palette
00374   pPalette=new unsigned char[768];
00375  
00376    if(pPalette==NULL)
00377     return IMG_ERR_MEM_FAIL;
00378  
00379   // VGA palette is the 768 bytes following the header
00380   memcpy(pPalette,&pData[pData[0]+18],768);
00381  
00382   // Palette entries are BGR ordered so we have to convert to RGB
00383    for(iIndex=0,iPalPtr=0;iIndex!=256;++iIndex,iPalPtr+=3)
00384     {
00385      bTemp=pPalette[iPalPtr];               // Get Blue value
00386      pPalette[iPalPtr]=pPalette[iPalPtr+2]; // Copy Red to Blue
00387      pPalette[iPalPtr+2]=bTemp;             // Replace Blue at the end
00388     }
00389  
00390   return IMG_OK;
00391  }
00392  
00393  
00394 void TGAImg::BGRtoRGB() // Convert BGR to RGB (or back again)
00395  {
00396   unsigned long Index,nPixels;
00397   unsigned char *bCur;
00398   unsigned char bTemp;
00399   short iPixelSize;
00400  
00401   // Set ptr to start of image
00402   bCur=pImage;
00403  
00404   // Calc number of pixels
00405   nPixels=iWidth*iHeight;
00406  
00407   // Get pixel size in bytes
00408   iPixelSize=iBPP/8;
00409  
00410    for(Index=0;Index!=nPixels;Index++)  // For each pixel
00411     {
00412      bTemp=*bCur;      // Get Blue value
00413      *bCur=*(bCur+2);  // Swap red value into first position
00414      *(bCur+2)=bTemp;  // Write back blue to last position
00415  
00416      bCur+=iPixelSize; // Jump to next pixel
00417     }
00418  
00419  }
00420  
00421  
00422 void TGAImg::FlipImg() // Flips the image vertically (Why store images upside down?)
00423  {
00424   unsigned char bTemp;
00425   unsigned char *pLine1, *pLine2;
00426   int iLineLen,iIndex;
00427  
00428   iLineLen=iWidth*(iBPP/8);
00429   pLine1=pImage;
00430   pLine2=&pImage[iLineLen * (iHeight - 1)];
00431  
00432    for( ;pLine1<pLine2;pLine2-=(iLineLen*2))
00433     {
00434      for(iIndex=0;iIndex!=iLineLen;pLine1++,pLine2++,iIndex++)
00435       {
00436        bTemp=*pLine1;
00437        *pLine1=*pLine2;
00438        *pLine2=bTemp;       
00439       }
00440     } 
00441  
00442  }
